critique: The document is an executive order focused on controlling federal spending by institutionalizing and reinvigorating the 'Administrative pay-as-you-go' (Administrative PAYGO) mechanism. This requires agencies to offset any increases in mandatory spending resulting from discretionary administrative actions with corresponding reductions elsewhere. The order aims to ensure agencies consider the costs of their actions and curtail costly administrative actions. It does not directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It centralizes some authority in OMB, giving the Director discretion in implementation and waiver decisions. The order reflects a conservative fiscal approach by emphasizing spending control and deficit reduction.
